description.narrative: This proposal aims to provide initial funding to help ICS to prepare for the development of a new and innovative movement that is based on the organization and participation of different LGBTIQ groups particularly the matured and successful ones. 3. Results and activities Result 3.1: a Consortium of LGBTIQ organizations and individuals who are capable, committed and willing to work together for the development of LGBTIQ movement in Vietnam Activity 3.1.1: an in-depth study to provide understanding of LGBTIQ individuals, particularly the matured and successful ones, on how they want to participate and contribute to the LGBTIQ movement. This study is also a mechanism to identify, engage and invite capable and committed LGBTIQ to participate into a leading LGBTIQ club. Activity 3.1.2: a leading LGBTIQ Consortium is established to effectively support the development of LGBTIQ movement as well as the establishment of a membership association. This Consortium composes of capable and committed organizationsand community members to provide guidance, creates funding opportunities and lobby space for LGBTIQ movement. Result 3.2: a new communication and campaign strategy is developed and implemented by the LGBTIQ Consortium to stimulate public discussion andsupport for LGBTIQ rights Activity 3.2.1: a study on the current public opinion on same sex marriage and how the Consortium should address remained concerns. This study will input thedevelopment of a communication strategy for the consortium members tocampaign. Activity 3.2.2: Develop a communication strategy anddesign/launch a social campaign based on the result of the study to increase the support of the public on equal marriage and rightsfor LGBTIQs. Result 3.3: ICS and other LGBTIQ organizations have capabilities to fundraise domestically from individuals and companies to sustain their operation and development Activity 3.3.1: A survey on individual giving among LGBTIQ communities and wider public is conducted to gauge the possibilities and inform the strategy to fundraise for LGBTIQ activities Activity 3.3.2: a matching fund is provided to ICS and other LGBGTIQ organizations to encourage them to fundraise domestically. In principle, this Matching Fund will match three dollars for every one dollar fundraised by ICS or other LGBTIQ organization from domestic sources (individuals and companies). The matching fund is calculated based on the gain (revenue minus cost) of the fundraising activities. Activity 3.3.3: Provide technical support for the implementation of the Matching Fund that is managed by ICS and the Consortium

participating-org.narrative: In November 2008, administrators and moderators from the 5 largest LGBT forums in Vietnam came together to form ICS with the mission to change the negative portrayals of Vietnamese LGBT people in the media. Since then, together with LGBT communities, ICS organizes activities to build LGBT pride and solidarity, and educate the public about sexual diversity. For instance, ICS organized the first ever public photo exhibition on same sex relationships in HCMC in 2009, which was later toured at 10 university campuses in Hanoi with the participation of over 15,000 students. In 2012 alone, ICS organized almost 60 events, including training workshops, talk shows with students, online campaigns, etc., and the first ever LGBT Flashmob in Vietnam, #Love is Love#,which was held in Hanoi, DaNang and Ho Chi Minh City to celebrate love and diversity. In May 2011, ICS helped found a chapter of PFLAG in Vietnam. ICS has also hosted dialogues between lawmakers, LGBT communities and PFLAG regarding the amendment of theFamily and Marriage Law and the Constitution. Thanks to all these efforts, ICS has become one of the leading LGBT institutions in Vietnam, representing communities in channeling their voices to lawmakers as well as protecting the human rights of LGBT people.
